text:
interesting question…curious to hear from others…but here are my thoughts:

from my limited understanding, most DAOs are formed primarily to raise money to achieve an intended goal. Folks who contributed money (ETH/SOL/etc) get *governing* tokens. I’ve been part of a few so far and all of them function more or less this way. So, i’m not sure why any existing service agency would want to distribute governing token as it sounds inefficient…

Perhaps, a new agency starting from scratch (web3 native) can leverage DAO model to put together a collective that can serve a group of clients.

But in this case, new members should be added based on their contribution (proof of work), rather than money. For instance, to become a member of the Agency X DAO, you need to do Y (work). Mods can review the work and promote the person to a “member”. Eventually, this type of DAO will have a collective of talented folks who can get the job done. So, Mods can attract the clients (supply). I’ve seen this type of DAOs getting formed recently and I think it can be replicated in service industry as well.

NFTs are relatively less complex. So, i think there are a handful of ways to leverage them…

text:
Great take <@U02AG6CLTV0> :raised_hands: I think DAOs are an interesting structure for governance. Imagine if you could create an agency with a bunch of people who have skin in the game and vote on which clients you should or shouldn't take... Who you should or shouldn't hire... Etc..

I'd be curious to hear your thoughts on the NFT functionalities that are less complex but could be used for agencies.
